僕のヒーローアカデミア (2019)

relatedanime.anime: Boku no Hero Academia the Movie: Futari no Hero
Boku no Hero Academia the Movie: Heroes:Rising

recommendations.recommendation: Compared to the previous seasons, this one was disappointing. Still for fans this is a must watch.

This series somehow continues to deliver. Each and every step has meaning, every action a purpose. There were brief moments where I thought, "Oh crap, are they starting filler?" And then, the purpose was revealed.
For any who thought maybe the series was going to start trickling off. They`ve kept this moving forward more and more, and I can`t wait for season 5. The setup for it is already immense.
Worth every moment.

My favourite season so far. It gets comparatively dark, dealing with themes of loss, failure, death and abuse to a degree the show hadn`t touched before, all grounded in powerfully written character development.
The characters were a real highlight this time around in general. Deku, Mirio & Eri act a a strong base for the season to build around, while a respectable amount of screentime & development is given to several of the side characters. It very much feels like the majority of the cast is coming into their own.
Serious, touching and still going strong. One of the best surprises in anime for me this year.

anime.description: * Based on a super hero manga series written and illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr44143 [Horikoshi Kouhei]. The villain world teeters on the brink of war now that http://anidb.net/ch92488 [All For One] is out of the picture. http://anidb.net/ch87108 [Shigaraki] of the http://anidb.net/ch92570 [League of Villains] squares off with http://anidb.net/ch98134 [Overhaul] of the yakuza, vying for total control of the shadows. Meanwhile, http://anidb.net/ch78198 [Deku] gets tangled in another dangerous internship as he struggles to keep pace with his upperclassman—http://anidb.net/ch98074 [Mirio]. Source: crunchyroll

externalentity.identifier: 僕のヒーローアカデミア_(アニメ)

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ojou-sama laugh
tag.description: A type of haughty laughter typical of rich young girls, as well as older rich women. Generally sounds like a high-pitched "OHOHOHOHOHOHO".

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: superhero
tag.description: In modern popular fiction, a superhero is a type of costumed heroic character who possesses supernatural or superhuman powers and who is dedicated to fighting crime, protecting the public, and usually battling supervillains. A female superhero is sometimes called a superheroine. Fiction centered on such characters, especially in American comic books since the 1930s, is known as superhero fiction. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: fighting
tag.description: For some reason or other one faction has to take it out on some opponent via fight or battle. Typical examples of this are all the anime with "endless pointless fighting" tag.

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: Weekly Shounen Jump
tag.description: The Weekly Shounen Jump is a Japanese manga magazine released on a weekly basis. Its main target audience consists of young males and it features several manga titles. The magazine was created by http://anidb.net/cr780 [Shueisha] in July, 1968, and was originally only called Shounen Jump, because it was not published every week at the time. A number of very famous shounen manga were or are published in it, such as http://anidb.net/a386 [Hokuto no Ken], http://anidb.net/a231 [Dragon Ball], http://anidb.net/a942 [City Hunter], http://anidb.net/a826 [Saint Seiya], http://anidb.net/a590 [Slam Dunk], http://anidb.net/a312 [Yuu Yuu Hakushou], http://anidb.net/a69 [One Piece], http://anidb.net/a239 [Naruto], http://anidb.net/a2369 [Bleach], http://anidb.net/a4563 [Death Note], http://anidb.net/a3468 [Gintama], to name a few of the most well-known.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

character.name: Midoriya Izuku
character.description: Midoriya Izuku, also known as Deku, is originally born without a Quirk, but he manages to catch the attention of the legendary hero http://anidb.net/ch78199 [All Might] and has since become his close pupil and a student at U.A. High, making him the ninth user of the One For All Quirk.

character.name: All Might
character.description: All Might is the No.1 Hero who bears the title of the world`s Symbol of Peace. He teaches Foundational Hero Studies at U.A. High School. He is the eighth user of the One For All Quirk after receiving it from http://anidb.net/ch92565 [Shimura Nana].

character.name: Todoroki Shouto
character.description: Todoroki Shouto is a student at U.A., training to become a Pro Hero. He got into U.A. through official recommendations.

character.name: All for One
character.description: All for One is the founder of the League of Villains. Once Japan`s most powerful villain and http://anidb.net/ch78199 [All Might]`s arch-nemesis, his true motives are unclear and his true identity unknown. His current goal is to raise http://anidb.net/ch87108 [Shigaraki Tomura] to become his eventual successor.

character.name: Deku
character.description: http://anidb.net/ch78198 [Izuku]`s second Hero Costume is a dark green full-body unitard with the same red boots and elbow pads. The knee pads have been extended to his legs and reach up to his thighs. It also has some design changes on the headgear and gloves.

character.name: Big 3
character.description: Big 3 is an informal group of three most prominent students of Yuuei Koukou.

character.name: La Brava
character.description: La Brava (real name Manami Aiba) is a villain sidekick of Gentle Criminal.

スクープ雄英1年A組
The Scoop on U.A. Class 1-A
Le scoop de la seconde A de Yuei
السبق الصحفي عن الفصل الأول-إيه من ثانوية يو.إيه
Scoop Yuuei 1 Nen A Gumi
episode.summary: Freelance journalist http://anidb.net/ch106141 [Tokuda Taneo] is sent to investigate All Might`s unknown successor.

episode.title: オーバーホール
Overhaul
Overhaul
أوفرهول
Overhaul
episode.summary: Overhaul pays a visit to the League of Villains, and Midoriya tries to find a place to do his work study. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボーイ・ミーツ...
Boy Meets...
Boy Meets...
الفتى يقابل...
Boy Meets...
episode.summary: Izuku battles Sir Nighteye so he can do his work study at Nighteye`s agency, but Nighteye has someone else in mind to be All Might`s successor... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 抗う運命
Fighting Fate
Lutte contre le destin
مواجهة القدر
Aragau Unmei
episode.summary: Izuku`s mind is swirling with feelings from his work study, so he goes and talks to All Might about it and learns about All Might`s fate. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ガッツだレッツラレッドライオット
Let`s Go, Gutsy Red Riot
Tiens bon, Red Riot !
انطلق بشجاعة، ريد رايوت
Guts Da Let`s La Red Riot
episode.summary: The U.A. work study students go out with their respective heroes and become involved in some big fights. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 嫌な話
An Unpleasant Talk
Une sale histoire
حديث غير سار
Iya na Hanashi
episode.summary: The work study students from U.A. attend a meeting of heroes gathered by Sir Nighteye and leave with new resolve. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: GO!!
Go!!
Go!!
انطلاق!!
Go!!
episode.summary: The work study students wait until the pro heroes find Eri and it`s time to start the operation to save her. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ビッグ3のサンイーター
Suneater of the Big Three
Sun Eater
سن-إيتر من الثلاثة الكبار
Big 3 no Sun Eater
episode.summary: The Shie Hassaikai is going all out to stop the heroes, and Suneater volunteers to take out the first batch of Eight Bullets members in their way. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 烈怒頼雄斗
Red Riot
Red Riot
ريد رايوت
Red Riot
episode.summary: As the fight with the Shie Hassaikai continues, Kirishima has to face his past when he and Fat Gum get separated from the others. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出向
Temp Squad
Intérimaires
فرقة مؤقتة
Shukkou
episode.summary: The Hassaikai gets some help from the League of Villains as the heroes continue to make their way to Chisaki to rescue Eri. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ルミリオン
Lemillion
Lemillion
لوميليون
Lemillion
episode.summary: The League of Villains stay true to their name in their fight. Meanwhile, Togata catches up to Chisaki and Eri first... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 見えない希望
Unforeseen Hope
Un espoir imprévu
أمل لا يرى
Mienai Kibou
episode.summary: Izuku, Eraser Head, and Sir Nighteye finally reach the area where Chisaki and the others are and find Togata past his limit... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 無限100%
Infinite 100%
100 % à l`infini
اللانهائية 100%

episode.summary: As the fight with the Shie Hassaikai reaches its climax, Chisaki looks back on how it all started, and Izuku uses All For One at 100%. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 明るい未来
Bright Future
Un avenir radieux
مستقبل مشرق
Akarui Mirai
episode.summary: As the heroes deal with the aftermath of the fight with the Shie Hassaikai, the vehicle transporting Chisaki has an encounter with the League of Villains... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燻る炎
Smoldering Flames
Un feu qui couve
نيران متصاعدة
Kusuburu Honoo
episode.summary: After the fight with the Shie Hassaikai, a new villain emerges, and the students who participated reflect on their own roles as future heroes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 掴めガキ心

اكسبوا قلوب هؤلاء الأطفال

episode.summary: Camie joins the provisional license training course and is added to the team working with the kids from Masegaki. Meanwhile, Endeavor has a serious talk with All Might. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホッコれ仮免講習

episode.summary: The trainees bond with the precocious Masegaki kids and life at U.A. goes back to normal as autumn approaches, but Aoyama has been acting strangely... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 文化祭って準備してる時が一番楽しいよね
Prepping for the School Festival Is the Funnest Part
Le plus amusant, c`est les préparatifs
الاستعداد للمهرجان الثقافي هو المرحلة الأكثر مرحًا
Bunkasaitte Junbi Shiteru Toki ga Ichiban Tanoshii yo ne
episode.summary: Class 1-A assigns roles for their performance at the school festival, and Gentle starts preparing his next plan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴールドティップスインペリアル
Gold Tips Imperial
Gold Tips Imperial
غولد تبس إمبريال
Gold Tips Imperial

Deku vs. Gentle Criminal

ديكو ضد جينتل كريمنال
Deku vs Gentle Criminal

episode.title: 垂れ流せ! 文化祭!
Let It Flow! School Festival!
Oublier les mauvais souvenirs

Tarenagase! Bunkasai!
